section.markdown:
- [OCGROWTH - Output in the Construction Industry Growth Rates][1]

- [OCIDEF - Output in the Construction Industry Implied Price Deflators][2]

- [OCINDEX - Output in the Construction Industry Index Numbers][3]

- [OCPRICES - Output in the Construction Industry Prices][4]

- [OCREGIO - Output in the Construction Industry Regional Splits][5]

- [OCSIZE - Output in the Construction Industry Sizebands][6]

- [OCTYPE - Output in the Construction Industry Type of Work][7]


  [1]: http://web.ons.gov.uk/ons/data/web/explorer/dataset-finder/-/q/dcDetails/Economic/OCGROWTH
  [2]: http://web.ons.gov.uk/ons/data/web/explorer/dataset-finder/-/q/dcDetails/Economic/OCIDEF

  [5]: http://web.ons.gov.uk/ons/data/web/explorer/dataset-finder/-/q/dcDetails/Economic/OCREGIO

  [7]: http://web.ons.gov.uk/ons/data/web/explorer/dataset-finder/-/q/dcDetails/Economic/OCTYPE

description.title: Output in the Construction Industry explorable datasets
description.summary: Construction output estimates are a short-term indicator of construction output by the private sector and public corporations within Great Britain and are produced from a monthly survey of 8,000 businesses in Great Britain. The estimates are produced and published at current prices (including inflationary price effects) and at chained volume estimates (with inflationary effects removed) both seasonally adjusted and non-seasonally adjusted.
description.metaDescription: Construction output estimates are a short-term indicator of construction output by the private sector and public corporations within Great Britain and are produced from a monthly survey of 8,000 businesses in Great Britain. The estimates are produced and published at current prices (including inflationary price effects) and at chained volume estimates (with inflationary effects removed) both seasonally adjusted and non-seasonally adjusted.
